tools.description: Description of one or more bioinformatics tools - application software with well-defined data processing functions (inputs, outputs and operations).  This includes simple tools with one or a few closely related functions, and complex, multimodal tools with many functions.  Tools may be available available for immediate use as online services, or in a form which which you can download, install, configure and run yourself.

name.description: Canonical software name assigned by the software developer or service provider.

toolID.description: Unique ID of the tool that is assigned upon registration of the software in bio.tools, normally identical to tool name.

version.description: Version (typically a version number) of the software assigned by the software developer or service provider.

versionID.description: Unique ID of a tool version that is assigned upon registration of the software in bio.tools.

doi.description: Canonical Digital Object Identifier of the software assigned by the software developer or service provider.

shortDescription.description: Short and concise textual description of the software function.

function.description: Details of a function the software provides, expressed in terms from the EDAM ontology.

uri.description: URL of an EDAM Operation concept.

term.description: An EDAM Operation term (preferred label or synonym).

data.description: Type of primary input data, if any (EDAM data).

uri.description: URL of an EDAM Data concept.

term.description: An EDAM Data term (preferred label or synonym).

format.description: Allowed format(s) of the input data (EDAM Format).

uri.description: URL of an EDAM Forrmat concept.

data.description: Type of primary output data, if any (EDAM Data).

uri.description: URL of an EDAM Data concept.

term.description: An EDAM Data term (preferred label or synonym).

format.description: Allowed format(s) of the output data (EDAM Format).

uri.description: URL of an EDAM Forrmat concept.

comment.description: Concise comment about this function, if not apparent from the software description and EDAM annotations.

labels.description: Miscellaneous scientific, technical and administrative details of the software, expressed in terms from controlled vocabularies.

topic.description: General scientific domain the software serves or other general category (EDAM Topic).

uri.description: URL of an EDAM Topic concept.

term.description: An EDAM Topic term (preferred label or synonym).

goTermID.description: Gene function including molecular function, cellular component and biological process.  The ID of Gene Ontology (GO) concept(s) are specified.

soTermID.description: Features which can be located on a biological sequence. The ID of Sequence Ontology (SO) concept(s) are specified.

taxId.description: NCBI taxonomy ID of taxonomic group the software (particularly database portals) caters for.

operatingSystem.description: The operating system supported by a downloadable software package.

language.description: Name of programming language the software source code was written in.

collectionID.description: Unique ID of a collection that the software has been assigned to within bio.tools.

maturity.description: How mature the software product is.

cost.description: Monetary cost of acquiring the software.

accessibility.description: Whether the software is freely available for use.

relation.description: Details of a relationship this software shares with other software registered in bio.tools.

biotoolsId.description: bio.tools ID (URL)  of an existing bio.tools entry which this software is related to.

type.description: Type of relation between this and another registered software.

apiSpec.description: Details of the API to a service including service endpoints.

baseURL.description: The base URL of a service, upon which one or more service endpoints are hung.

endpoint.description: Details of an endpoint to a service, i.e. a URL that can be used to invoke a particular function of a service.

httpMethod.description: HTTP method used by the endpoint.

urlTemplate.description: Template for a URL fragment, which when appended to the base URL, defines the syntax of a valid resolvable URL. The template can include parameters that must be substituted before the URL is resolved.

output.description: Details of output data provided by the endpoint.

data.description: Type of output data, if any (EDAM Data).

uri.description: URL of an EDAM Data concept.

term.description: An EDAM Data term (preferred label or synonym).

format.description: Possible format(s) of the output data (EDAM Format).

uri.description: URL of an EDAM Forrmat concept.

term.description: An EDAM Format term (preferred label or synonym).

summary.description: A textual summary of a service endpoint.

parameter.description: A query string parameter in the template URL that that must be substituted before the URL is resolved.

urlTemplateFragment.description: A fragment from the URL template corresponding to a URL parameter, which is replaced by some value when the service is called.

data.description: Type of data (EDAM Data) of a parameter of an endpoint.

uri.description: URL of an EDAM Data concept.

term.description: An EDAM Data term (preferred label or synonym).

comment.description: A comment about a parameter of an endpoint.

link.description: A miscellaneous link for the software e.g. repository, issue tracker or mailing list.

url.description: A link of some relevance to the software (URL).

type.description: The type of data, information or system that is obtained when the link is resolved.

download.description: A link to a download for the software, e.g. source code, virtual machine image or container.

url.description: Link to download (or repo providing a download) for the software.

cmd.description: A useful command pertinent to the download, e.g. for getting or installing a tool.

documentation.description: A link to documentation about the software e.g. manual, API specification or training material.

url.description: Link to documentation on the web for the tool.

type.description: Type of documentation that is linked to.

doi.description: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) of a publication about the software.

pmid.description: PubMed Identifier (PMID) of a publication about the software.

pmcid.description: PubMed Central Identifier (PMCID) of a publication about the software.

contact.description: Details of primary point(s) of contact, e.g. person, helpdesk or mailing list.

email.description: Email address of the primary contact.

credit.description: An individual or organisation that should be credited for the software.

name.description: Name of the entity that is credited.

email.description: mail address of the entity that is credited.

url.description: URL for the entity that is credited, e.g. homepage of an institute.

orcidId.description: Unique identifier (ORCID iD) of a person that is credited.

gridId.description: Unique identifier (GRID ID) of an organisation that is credited.

typeEntity.description: Type of entity that is credited.

typeRole.description: Role performed by entity that is credited.

elixirInfo.description: Information for ELIXIR internal purposes, maintained by ELIXIR Hub.

lastReviewExternalSab.description: Date of last review by the External SAB.

lastReviewElixirSab.description: Date of last review by the ELIXIR SAB.

inSDP.description: Whether the resource is listed in a node Service Delivery Plan.

isCoreDataResource.description: Whether the resource is an official core data resource.
